results.title: The Invisible force
results.creator_credit: Christopher Haws, Michael Latham and Landmark Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Start Here: Adventures into Science”.
Konrad, the kitchen robot, shows students that gravity and friction determine how everything on earth behaves during movement. Using simple experiments that can be reproduced in class or at home, he reveals the nature of the forces acting upon us.

results.title: Air at work
results.creator_credit: Christopher Haws, Michael Latham and Video Arts
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Start Here: Adventures into Science”.
This program presents experiments that demonstrate the varying forces that are created when air moves. Demonstrates the theory of flight and the creation of weather patterns.

results.title: Mr. & Mrs. Edgehill (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Gavin Millar, Alan Shallcross, Arts and Entertainment Network, Quintet Films and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Star Quality : The Stories of Noel Coward”.
Lady Cynthia is a woman of wealth and position, but she is touched and amazed at the love and devotion Mr. and Mrs. Edgehill feel for one another. What is it that makes this ordinary couple so content with their life - even on a remote and desolate South Sea island. Starring Judi Dench and Ian Holm and adapted from a story by Noel Coward.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gavin Millar, Alan Shallcross, Arts and Entertainment Network, Quintet Films and BBC-TV

results.title: Star Quality (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Alan Dosser, Alan Shallcross, Quintet Films and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Star Quality : The Stories of Noel Coward”.
At first a young writer, whose new play is being staged, thinks that the production will be plain sailing, but soon he’s convinced that he and his play are doomed when the star quality of the leading lady and the director come into conflict. Screenplay by Stanley Price, based on the original by Noel Coward. Starring Susannah York, Ian Richardson and David Yellan.

results.title: [Viana Stern]
results.brief_description:
A U.F.O visits the Sydney Harbour Bridge; a Japanese tourist takes photos; a person meditates; people exercise and a plane flys by.

An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

group.title: Stamps coming to life: Anderson Creek Primary School

results.title: [Aran Spottiswood]
results.brief_description:
A Fibbert crab comes to life by eating the stamp that it is enclosed in and proceeds to swim out to a blue sea.

An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

group.title: Stamps coming to life: Anderson Creek Primary School

results.title: Animated Stamp - [Mitchell Gaffney]
results.brief_description: Asked to “make a stamp come to life”. Mitchell has created a vibrant, multicolored traffic flow in a stamp featuring Sydney Harbour Bridge. The price of the stamp rises as the increase of traffic flow occurs across the bridge. Highly Commended. An animated short entered to ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

group.title: Stamps coming to life: Anderson Creek Primary School

results.title: [Ryo Parker]
results.brief_description:
A sailor experiences a huge fire and subsequent sinking of his sailing ship after he hits a large rock. A fish saves him as he nearly drowns. Once on shore, the sailor goes to the shipyards and purchases another ship and sails off into sea.

An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.
